text: Precise alignment of sites required for mu enhancer activation in B cells .
The lymphocyte - specific immunoglobulin mu heavy-chain gene intronic enhancer is regulated by multiple nuclear factors .

The previously defined minimal enhancer containing the muA , muE3 , and muB sites is transactivated by a combination of the ETS-domain proteins <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Ets-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in nonlymphoid cells .

text: The core GGAAs of the muA and muB sites are separated by 30 nucleotides , suggesting that ETS proteins bind to these sites from these same side of the DNA helix .
We tested the necessity for appropriate spatial alignment of these elements by using mutated enhancers with altered spacings .
